If any of the grouped enemy has <style="status">Resistance</style> to the damage Element Type, the damage will be <style="value">halved (round-down)</style> (inefficient) before being applied.

enemy.group.add.tooltip.content:
Click to create a new grouping of enemies.

Grouping Enemies allows you to target <style="value">multiple</style> enemies at the same time using combined attack points.

Grouped Enemies will <style="value">share</style> <style="status">Fortifications</style> and <style="status">Resistances</style>.
enemy.group.update.tooltip.content:
Click to change the group this enemy belongs to.

Grouping Enemies allows you to target <style="value">multiple</style> enemies at the same time using combined attack points.

Grouped Enemies will <style="value">share</style> <style="status">Fortifications</style> and <style="status">Resistances</style>.

enemy.reputation.tooltip:
How many Reputation points you will gain (or lose) by defeating this enemy.

Some enemies are popular in the kingdom, others are loathed and the locals will be happy when you get rid of them.
enemy.tooltip.attacks.title: Attacks
enemy.tooltip.resistances.title: Resistances & Immunities
enemy.rampaging.name: Rampaging
enemy.rampaging.description: Some Enemies are out in the open rampaging. You can attack them by being adjacent or you will trigger them if you move adjacent to adjacent. The local population is greatful when you defeat them and your <style="status">reputation will increase</style>
enemy.rampaging.rewards.label: Rewards
enemy.rampaging.challenge.selection.titl: <style="value">[Optional]</style> Select other Rampaging Enemies to challenge
enemy.status.unknown.tooltip: Unknown {0}. Start the battle to reveal it.
enemy.summoned.name: Summoned
enemy.summoned.description: Some Magical Enemies (typically Arcanum types), have the ability to Summon other Enemies to come to their aid in Battle instead of performing direct Attacks. When a Summoning Attack occurs, the Summoner will spawn a new Enemy, this is that summoned enemy's Attack that you will need to block to consider the Summoner as successfully blocked.
enemy.elusive.name: Elusive
enemy.elusive.description: Some Enemies are hard to grasp unless you Block them first. These Elusive enemies have different Armor values based on whether they have been Blocked (lower value) or Unblocked (higher value).
enemy.xp.tooltip: How many Experience points you will gain by defeating this enemy.
enemy.exploration.battle.cta.label: Attack

enemy.elusive.armor.unblocked.tooltip.co: This Enemy is Elusive and has different Armor values if Blocked vs Unblocked. This is the Armor value if the Enemy is NOT Blocked. You must match or exceed this value using Attacks to Defeat the Enemy.
enemy.elusive.armor.blocked.tooltip.head: Enemy Armor if <style="status">Blocked</style>
enemy.elusive.armor.blocked.tooltip.cont: This Enemy is Elusive and has different Armor values if Blocked vs Unblocked. This is the Armor value if the Enemy is Blocked. You must match or exceed this value using Attacks to Defeat the Enemy.
